title: How to Cook Pepes Ubi

steps.headline: Peel the cassava and clean it with clean water.
steps.description: Prepare a big bowl and grate the cassava with a scrapping board.

steps.headline: Melt the brown sugar in a pot.
steps.description: Add a little water to it. This way, the sugar won't stick to the pot.

steps.headline: Mix the grated cassava with the grated coconut and add the salt.
steps.description: Stir it until all the ingredients are mixed.

steps.headline: Add the brown sugar little by little to the dough.
Stir it until the sugar is mixed well with the dough.
Prepare the banana leaf and cut it as you like.
Take 2 tablespoons of dough and put it on the banana leaf.
steps.description: Fold it as exactly shown in the picture. Do this with the rest of the dough.

steps.headline: Prepare the steam pot and arrange the pepes in the pot.
Pepes Ubi is ready to eat.
steps.description: Serve it along with coffee or tea.

text: Peel the cassava and clean it with clean water. Prepare a big bowl and grate the cassava with a scrapping board. Melt the brown sugar in a pot. Add a little water to it. This way, the sugar won't stick to the pot. Mix the grated cassava with the grated coconut and add the salt. Stir it until all the ingredients are mixed. Add the brown sugar little by little to the dough.  Stir it until the sugar is mixed well with the dough.  Prepare the banana leaf and cut it as you like.  Take 2 tablespoons of dough and put it on the banana leaf. Fold it as exactly shown in the picture. Do this with the rest of the dough. Prepare the steam pot and arrange the pepes in the pot.  Steam the pepes approximately 60 minutes.  Pepes Ubi is ready to eat. Serve it along with coffee or tea.
